alert.note: Alert for Dallam; Hartley (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 9:20PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Dallam and northwestern Hartley Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 919 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles southeast of Sedan, or 11 miles north of Amistad, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Dallam and northwestern Hartley Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for the Panhandle of Texas.
